caption.p: The six breaches of containment and eradication programmes, extended from Grice et al. ( 2010)

tr.td: Plants reproduce within the occupied zone
Plants reproduce in the buffer zone

Propagules disperse beyond the buffer zone as a result of a seeding event in the buffer zone, but resulting plants are located and removed before seeding (estimate of d correct, breach due to failure to locate and remove plants from the buffer zone)
Propagules disperse beyond the buffer zone as a result of an incorrectly estimated dispersal distance, but resulting plants are located and removed before seeding (estimate of d incorrect)
Propagules disperse and produce reproductive plants beyond the buffer zone but less than one maximum dispersal distance beyond the original occupied zone – a ‘close’ breach
Propagules disperse and produce reproductive plants beyond the buffer zone and greater than one maximum dispersal distance from the original occupied zone – a ‘distant’ breach
